Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is reminiscent of the oppressive control over speech experienced in East Germany.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth, as it has a history of spreading misleading information.
Open discussion and dialogue are necessary to combat misinformation, not government-imposed restrictions.
Individuals are capable of discerning truth from misinformation without government intervention.
Main Themes: Trust in individual judgment over government or expert opinion
Notable Quotes: The new proposed Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation Bill is a good step along the way of recreating this nightmare.
In order to combat misinformation and disinformation, we need honest and open discussion and dialogue, not the government deciding what currently goes as 'truth'.
I do not accept any restrictions or limitations on my freedom of speech.
